intro: Tithymalus rosularis, commonly known as the Rosular Tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its foliage consists of finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often aromatic. Tithymalus rosularis is typically found in meadows and woodland edges, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
